hints.content:
Levi knows $\purpleD{877}$ kinds of butterflies. That equals the $\maroonD{443}$ kinds of moths Levi knows, plus some more kinds.

![A tape diagram models that the 877 kinds of butterflies are equal to the 443 kinds of moths and an unknown number of more kinds.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/bbd1c26854b9fe3a6ade860a1d52532d5b86460e)

$\purpleD{877}-\maroonD{443}=\blueE{?}$

![Part 1 of 2. Place value blocks show 877 blocks with 443 blocks crossed out](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/c9a222f26e52e4a6bcce4c0666f21a7eec50e747)

![Part 2 of 2 of previous image.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/4be66d57cfb491f463da8aed219f23469497ab92)
Levi knows $\blueE{434}$ more kinds of butterflies than moths.

question.content:
The table gives the numbers of kinds of insects Levi knows.

Group | Number of kinds
:- | -:
Beetles | $117$
Butterflies | $877$
Moths | $443$

**How many more kinds of butterflies than moths does Levi know?**

[[â˜ƒ numeric-input 1]] kinds
